alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:40PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 239 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Gordon, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Clinton, Hoover Lake, Lone Butte, Irwin, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes Highway 20 between mile markers 95 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
